metadata.Title: CVE-2020-18976 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer Overflow in Tcpreplay v4.3.2 allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service via the 'do_checksum' function in 'checksum.c'. It can be triggered by sending a crafted pcap file to the 'tcpreplay-edit' binary. This issue is different than CVE-2019-8381.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-18976` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpreplay - 4.3.3-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tcpreplay package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.3-2').
